inn1.comm: short of a length, just outside off, pushed between cover and extra cover for one
Dilshan makes a watchful start, which is good to know. Leaves this alone outside off. Not too wide, mind you
strays on the pads, and Dilshan will like this. Fullish, on the pads, and he accepts it with glee by flicking it over square leg. That's what you need when you are out of form
short of a length, gives him the width, and Dilshan slashes it to third man for one
short of a length, pitched on off, angling away, left alone
beauty. Length ball, on off, looks like one that will swing in, but leaves him upon pitching. Lucky to not edge it
and even Tanvir provides Dilshan a freebie. Half-volley on the pads, dispatched right of midwicket. And it's a huge no-ball too
slower ball, short and wide, and Akmal misfields at point to allow them a single

short of a length, just outside off, seaming in, nudged past midwicket, and Tharanga comes back for a lazy second. Hafeez's throw misses by six inches. He was gone if it had hit. Mahela grimaces in the dressing room
length ball, on off, defended to cover
nicely played. This is shaping in towards middle and leg, and he just provides it direction between midwicket and mid-on
a much better delivery. Heavy ball. Short of a length, outside off, seaming in, beats the bat, hits the back leg in front, but the extra bounce saves him
length ball, just outside off, left alone with the angle
short of a length, Tharanga pushes to cover, takes the general two steps down the pitch, but Dilshan charges up. Comes back in time, though
loose drive from Tharanga. Length on off, slight seam away. Tharanga doesn't move his feet, and pushes at it. Beaten
that's better from Tharanga. Similar delivery, slightly closer to Tharanga, which is why he connects with the drive, and places it between point and cover-point
length, on the pads, defended to short midwicket
bouncer from Gul, on the stumps, Tharanga ducks under it
dug in again, chest high, middle and off, Tharanga keeps it down
length ball, on off, driven to mid-off
short of a length, on off, Dilshan pushes at it, and is beaten by the seam
extra bounce and seam here. Slightly shorter than the previous one, on leg stump, Dilshan plays at it, and is beaten. Sarfraz collects this in front of his chest
fuller, stump to stump, Dilshan is forward in defence
another heavy ball, hits him on the thigh as he looks to work it to leg
short of a length, just outside off, left alone
beautiful punch shot. Short of a length, in front of off, and he just meets it. No intent to hit it. Just a connection. Through extra cover it flies
Gul comes back with a beauty of his own. Pitches on leg, hits the seam, and moves away, beating the bat in front of off stump
length, on off, defended off the front foot
short of a length, no room, pushed to cover
dug in, rib-high, on middle and leg, worked to leg
tries the bouncer, looks outside leg to me, but not called wide
length ball outside off, allowed to angle away
yes, no, no... short of a length, pushed to point, Dilshan wants a single, but Tharanga sends him back rightly
length ball, pitched outside leg, flicked away nicely past square leg
big wide down the leg side
short of a length, no room, hits him on the thigh pad
short of a length, outside off, allowed to pass through, dies at Sarfraz
fuller, driving length, and also on the pads, and Dilshan has crashed this right back past the bowler
short of a length, on the pads, pushed to midwicket
another lovely punch from Tharanga. Short of a length, on off, and without seeming to hitting it, he has blasted it between cover and extra cover
cramps him up with the angle this time, pushed to cover
headed for top of off, nicely defended by Tharanga
short of a length, this one stops at him a little, and Tharanga hits it uppishly to the left of mid-on. Doesn't carry to Afridi
wide length ball, Dilshan goes for the booming drive, and is beaten as it holds its line
Tanvir strikes. This is a length ball, outside off, lands on the upright seam, holds its line, and takes the edge of the pushing bat. Tharanga walks
short of a length, moving in, defended in front of off
too straight, and Sanga punishes him. Just short of a leg, just leg side of middle, and he glances it fine after moving across a little
too straight again, but this time Sanga is beaten by the movement, and gets just a leg-bye
Dilshan opens the face, soft hands, and this lands short of second slip
length ball, outside off, watches it into Sarfraz's gloves
length ball, angling in, pushed to midwicket
fuller, but still short of driving length, defended to mid-on
pitches outside leg, easily worked away for a single
bouncer from Gul, over the top of off, and Dilshan sways out of its line
how did that miss? Top delivery from Gul. Seams back in from outside off, Dilshan drives at it, gets an inside edge that evades the stumps, the keeper and leg slip
fuller, on off, Dilshan drives, and gets a thicker inside edge, towards midwicket
short of a length, seaming into the pads, worked to the right of fine leg for two

Wrong end. Steered square, Akmal dives full-length, outstanding save. Dilshan and Sanga are at the same end - Sanga ball-watching. Akmal, though, throws at the same end, and misses. Sanga survives. Had he lobbed this to the bowler's end, Sanga was a goner. The back-up throw had a chance too, but it missed from short mdiwcket
pushed with an open face, between cover-point and point, timed well enough to get two
pushed with soft hands, a near tip and run to leg
length ball, wide of off, left alone
another run-out chance. Misbah is sharp at short midwicket, and he wants to surprise Dishan who is backing up. Misses the stumps
short and wide, cut away to deep point where Azhar fumbles
the slider now, gets an inside edge on the pad
short of a length, just outside off, pushes to cover
short of a length again, no room, punched to short cover
slower through the air, sliding in, driven to long-off for one
slow again, on a length, on off, pushed to long-off for one
extra bounce first up. Short of a length, outside off, chest high, pushed to point. 138ks
now the swing away from a left-hand batsman. Length ball, outside off, left alone. Good start so far
length ball, angling in, pushed wide of mid-on for one
short of a length, pitched leg, angling towards off, defended
half-volley on off, 135ks, no swing, driven past extra cover, all along the ground
length ball, just outside off, pushed to the right of mid-off
tossed up, legbreak outside off, risky single to cover, and Sanga has to dive to make it
full, on the pads, worked away for a single
flighted outside off, driven to short cover
sliding in towards middle, Dilshan almost late, but keeps this out
shorter, wider, punched past short cover

non-turning legbreak, and a huge shout for a catch at the wicket. Tossed up outside off, Sanga plays for the turn, but the ball gores straight on. Sarfraz lets out a huge shout, Afridi joins belatedly, but no response from the umpire. Sanga is a bit bemused. There was a noise, but not an apparent edge
short, sharp, beats the pull, hits the thigh, and they steal a leg-bye
length ball, on the pads, 137ks, that's a bit hit-me, and he flicks it past midwicket
length ball, outside off, Dilshan is forward and pushes it to sweeper-cover
full, on the pads, but he finds midwicket this time, who has come out of the clip cordon
short, widish, slashed to third man, where Gul does well despite a bad bounce
that's a Dilshan special. Short of a length, wide, Dilshan puts half a step forward, and punches it through cover. All along the ground it goes
flighted, middle and leg, driven to long-on for one
legbreak, hit to point where Akmal is alert
sliding in, too straight, though, and Dilshan glances it fine from in front of leg
short of a length, on off, turning away, pushed to cover
flighted outside off, much slower but still 88ks, driven to long-off
short of a length, angling in, worked away to deep midwicket for one
length ball outside off, defended watchfully
fuller, closer to off, defended
short of a length, on off, slight turn away, pushed back to him
Sanga dances down the track, is beaten by the dip, and kicks it away
full, on off, flicked down to long-on for one
length ball, leg-stump line, played with an open face to cover

and a breakthrough he provides. Who could have guessed this? A flat, straight loosener, Sanga goes back to punch this. Does it stop a bit? Perhaps. Perhaps not. However, he ends up lobbing this off the toe end, back for a soft catch to Hafeez. Don't shake Hafeez's hand any time soon. You might turn to gold
length ball, offbreak, turned to square leg
flighted outside off, defended to cover
toppie, on off, defended to leg
more action the ball, turning in towards off, defended back to him
quicker, pushed through, accurate, defended again
pushed to the left of Ajmal. Not top far off him at all, and Dilshan steals a single. Even if Ajmal had hit, Dilshan was in
straighter one this time, worked to square leg
offbreak now, pushed to leg again
flighted on off, worked to square leg again
nice offbreak, on off, turning in, defended back to him
quicker one, and the doosra too. Chandi wants to work it to leg, gets a leading edge back to him. Ten balls for no runs for Chandi
non-turning offbreak, takes a thick edge to short third
floated outside off, no feet from Dilshan as he flashes. Beaten
defended to leg, with the turn
pushed through, into the pads, worked away for a single - first run off Hafeez
Chandimal steps out, beaten in the flight, pushes this to midwicket
slower through the air, Chandi shimmies again, reaches the pitch of the ball, drives to long-on for his first run
flat offbreak, worked away to square leg
big sweep, misses, but he has managed to get outside the line of off
Chandi is getting anxious. Steps out again. Ajmal bowls the doosra. Recovers well to get bat on this

Nearly gone. The pressure was building up. It was obvious. Ajmal has almost done it with a short ball that bounces on him, and takes the top edge on the cut. It flies over point. Is this the turning point for Chandimal?
beaten in the flight again, pushes at it, though, and gets it wide of midwkcet
length ball on the pads, pushed to midwicket
length ball outside off, sliding in, defended
Chandi is really anxious here. Sees the flighted ball, and goes for a big sweep. Well early into it, and gets a bottom edge onto the pad
quick, 96ks, into the pads, nicely guided past short fine leg. That will make Chandimal feel better
wide down the leg side, and they take one off the deflection of the keeper's body
flighted outside off, driven to sweeper-cover
fired into the pads, worked away for a single
length ball on off, stays back to punch it to cover
length ball on the pads, worked away for one
short of a length, pitched outside leg, Dilshan misses on the flick, gets a leg-bye
short, angling in, steered away to third man
angling into the pads, worked away for an easy single
short of a length, angling in towards off, defended to cover
short of a length, slightly wide, but angling in, and beats him on the back-foot push. Stays low too
full, outside leg, swept away to deep square
length ball, on off, holding its line, defended off the back foot
full, middle and off, driven to long-on
slower through the air, Dilshan slightly early, pushing in front of his body, hits it in the air, but it doesn't carry to short cover
tries the dangerous cut off Afridi, gets the bat down in time, but can;t beat point

full, fired outside leg, and Dilshan helps it along its way to bring up his fifty. This has been a responsible innings where he has respected the conditions, the bowling and the format, and yet has gone at a strike-rate of 87
short, 131ks, flat-batted in front of square, gets a couple
shooter. Chandimal goes for the cut, gets a bottom edge as it stays low, but it has been signalled byes
length ball, on off, defended to cover
slower ball, Dilshan adjusts well, pushes it to mid-on for one. Soft hands
nice shot. Short, angling in, gets on top of it, and steers it square of third man
short of a length again, dabbed to third man for a single
starts with a wide ball outside off, and Sarfraz is beaten by the late movement
length ball outside off, left alone
left alone outside off
this one shapes in towards middle and leg, he falls over a little, but keeps it out, and places it wide of midwicket
more swing for him. Not outrageous swing, just a little shape in. Dilshan gets an inside edge onto the pad
this one goes the other way. Short of a length, on off, seams away. beaten as he pushes at it

No slip. This has been a good over, and ends it up with a sucker delivery outside off. Really full, and Dilshan drives at, getting an edge that goes low through the vacant slip region. It could have carried to slip, though
slow offbreak, worked to the right of square leg for one
flat, on the stumps, worked away for an easy single
toppie, middle and leg, pushed straight to square leg
nicely played. He knows fine leg is square, and he gets inside the line, and laps it fine. Gul, though, puts an excellent dive at the fine leg boundary to save one run
toppie again, Dilshan has no clue as he looks to open the face, and gets an inside edge
tip and run, placing this to the right of cover
short of a length, stump to stump, worked to leg for one
short of a length, just outside off, pushed to point
another edged boundary off Rahat. Full and wide this time, Chandimal drives at it, gets a thick edge that flies well wide of the slip
Sharp brute. Digs this one in, and gets it to rear at his throat at 141ks. Chandimal fends this, and the leading edge flies through the vacant gully region
this is short and wide, and he has cut this past point for four. Tough initiation for Rahat, but the promise is there
length ball, on the pads, worked away to deep square leg for one
short, turning in towards off, punched away wide of sweeper-cover for two
short again, punched away again, gets a single to sweeper-cover
tospinner, worked away from in front of the stumps, gets a single wide of midwicket
quickish again, worked wide of midwicket again for a single
flighted, slower, pushed back to him
stops in the stride, fires this into the pads, pushed to square leg
late-cuts him, a risky shot, but places it past point
quick outside off, pushed to cover
quick slider again, played back to him
flighted, middle and leg, pushed down to long-on
slight turn for this legbreak, Chandimal stays back to defend
quick, into the pads, helped away for a single
non-turner outside off, Chandimal pushes outside off, and is beaten
pushed to short midwicket
slows this one, opens the face, but can't beat short third man
cut away to deep point
full, on the pads, swept away for a single to deep square
slow through the air again, Chandimal leaves the crease, but doesn't try anything adventurous. Pushed to midwicket
slider again, Dilshan pushes back to Afridi
shorter, faster, 101ks, pushed to midwicket
slows this one down, legbreak outside off, 87ks, beats Dilshan's cut
quick again, on off, defended to cover
short of a length, on the pads, worked away for an easy single

Afridi strikes finally. Slower through the air, and that's what made Chandimal play for the turn here. Pitches on off, and finds Chandimal playing well outside the line as this one slides trhough and raps him on the pad in front of middle and off. Easy lbw decision for the umpire
laps this one from in front of off, gets a single
toppie outside off, beats Jayawardene's attempt at a cut
gets inside the line of this offbreak, turns this to square leg
topspinner again, Mahea plays this with a closed face, in front of stumps
quick, into the pads, hits the pad and goes for a leg-bye
shortish offbreak, punched to cover
full outside off, defended back to him
slower through the air, Mahela premeditates the lap shot, hitting this straight to short fine leg, no the bounce
angling into the pads, worked past midwicket for two - soft hands do the trick
length ball, outside off, defended back
short of a length, quick, Mahela uses the pace, guides it with an open face past short third man. Tanvir is not exceptionally quick at short third
full, fast, down leg. Sarfraz does well to collect this yorker
slider, angling in, worked away for a single
More premeditation from Mahela. Tries the reverse-sweep this time, and finds short third man
leaves the crease this time to work this to deep square for a single
floater outside off, and beats Dilshan's cut
turning into the pads, helped away for a single
pauses in the delivery stride, provides a half-volley, driven to long-on
slower through the air, full, outside off, pushed to long-on for another single
starts with a shortish delivery on the pads, worked away for a single
offbreak, worked between square leg and midwicket for a single
fired into the pads, Afridi over-runs at short fine leg, and allows two runs. Misjudgement there
full, quick, on the pads, pushed to midwicket
flighted, on off, no room, turning in, defended back to him

Has Tanvir missed a run-out here? MJ is late to start as Dilshan dabs this to short third. Tanvir is slow, too, and fires in a half-volley throw. As Sarfraz hits the stumps with his gloves, MJ is out. The bails come off in the next frame - and there is a huge lag, we are working with a slow frame rate here - and by then MJ is in, only slightly in. The correct decision given the technology available. Had Tanvir been slightly quicker, though, Pakistan would have had their man
length ball, middle and leg, pushed to long-on for one
MJ premeditates with success this time. Stands face on, gets down on a knee, and scoops this length ball over the keeper's head. Not a lap, not a paddle, but a scoop
regulation sweep this time, and he has played it along the ground, but fine of deep square leg
flatter, middle and off, pushed to deep midwicket for one
fired in, stays low, hits the toe end and goes to midwicket
full into the pads, and he finds midwicket again
tospinner, MJ goes back, helps this around the corner for one
fired into the pads, pitched outside leg actually, and glanced away between keeper and short fine leg
full, outside off, driven to mid-off for one
Nearly gone. Toppie from Ajmal. MJ looks to work him to leg, but the ball doesn't turn, and the leading edge lobs wide of Ajmal, and lands just short
tries the regulation sweep, but can't beat short fine leg
shorter, and MJ wants to pull, but the ball stays low, and hits his pad just outside the line of off
short and wide, cut away to the sweeper for one
length ball,  outside off, dabbed away to third man for one
short of a length, no room, rib-high, pushed to cover
short of a length again, provides a little bit of room, and he punches it to the sweeper on the off side
MJ moves across early, and Umar Gul slips in the bouncer. Beats the pull. An innings full of premeditated strokes from Mahela

oh this is more the Mahela we know. Length ball outside off, and he leans into the drive, and crashes it past cover. Then runs all the way to the non-striker's to tap the bat in, as he always does when he hits a four
punched to cover, and MJ sends Dilshan back
flighted outside off, played with an open face to point
quick on the pads, and he sweeps it straight to short fine leg
tossed up, on the pads, pushed to long-on for one - enters the 90s
dropped?. The straighter one Ajmal outside off, Mahela plays for the offbreak, edges it, but Sarfraz spills it
swept from outside off, for a single
legbreak, cut away, Akmal gets hand to it at point, saving three runs
another dive from Akmal at point, more runs saved
slower through the air, full, driven straight to extra cover
quicker one, slider, on off, punched to point
flighted again, full toss, driven back to Afridi - four straight dots
stays slow, cut to point where Akmal gets a bad bounce to allow a single
nicely flighted on off, pushed to long-off for one
reverse-sweep, and he has done this neatly. Tossed up on off, he gets his body outside the line, and then plays the reverse-sweep, rolling his wrists on it, beating short third man - 50 for the stand
worked to leg but not past short midwicket
topspinner, on off, MJ looks to work to leg, but beaten by the pace off the wicket
offbreak outside off, beats his sweep, but he has got well outside the line of off - the boundary has been follwoed by three dots
quick offbreak, no room at all, defended to midwicket
short of a length, punched to point again
flighted outside off, drive ball, and driven to long-off for one
MJ charges down the track, yorks himself up, but the inside edge only helps him place this wide of long-on to allow the second
MJ wants the late-cut now, from inside the gloves of the keeper, but it also hits MJ's glove, so the ball doesn't travel, and he gets just a single
into the pads, worked away for a two to deep square leg, and Afridi is not happy with the deep fielder
another single into the leg side
length ball, swinging in a little, pushed to sweeper-cover for one
late-cuts this from in front of the stumps, and Tanvir fumbles yet again at third man
angling into the pads, helped away for a single to fine leg
oh oh oh... Sharp short delivery from Gul, Dilshan wants to run this down, but the extra bounce nearly gets him. Dilshan withdraws from the shot at the last moment

short again, straight too, and he has pulled this to deep square. Leaps high in the air, then Dilshan glances up towards the sky, removes the helmet and accepts the applause. Gets a pat on the back from Gul too. A responsible innings after the much-earned criticism in the first match
length ball on off, pushed wide of cover for one
Jayawardene charges at him, and is cramped by an offbreak, gets a single to square leg
slower through the air, Dilshan early into the flick, gets hit on the pad
doosra, it starts outside leg, and is swept away for a single
Mahela makes room, gets a short delivery, and cuts it in front of square for two

How is that not out? MJ has moved right across in front of the stumps to try to lap this fine. Ajmal fires it in full and straight, and hits him flush on the pad. Is it the angle from round the stumps that has saved him? Pitched outside leg. Top decision there
short, on off, punched away to sweeper-cover for one
slog across the line, and this short-of-a-length delivery beats him. Slightly early into him
slower ball, 116ks, but on a length and turning into middle and leg, and MJ makes room to thrash this past midwicket
top delivery that goes for four runs. Gul digs this in short, and it moves in sharply and hits Jayawardene's glove to go between keeper and third man
Missed run-out chance. Yorker now, hot straight to extra cover, MJ gives up as he takes the single but Misbah's throw misses by a long way
bouncer, head-high, keeps the hook down, gets a single
nearly bowled him. tossed up on leg, Dilshan looking to make room, but the sharp offbreak follows him, hits the pad, and nearly trickles onto the stumps
short, pulled away to deep midwicket for one
reverse-seeps this from well outside leg, all along the ground, past point, and the sweeper-cover has no chance. A fitting way to reach fifty in an innings full of innovation and premeditation
bowled'im. MJ shimmies down, plays for an offbreak, looking to go inside out, but this one doesn't turn and hits the top of off. Ajmal shows emotion through a fistpump
offbreak outside off, hit to point with an open face
sharp quick offbreak at 90ks, beats Perera's attempt at a drive
he has smoked it. Slower ball, in the slot, on a length outside off, angling in, Dilshan plants the front foot down and smashes it over midwicket
short, wide outside off, looks to pull it, and it hurries onto him. Ends up hitting it back to Tanvir
short again, Dilshan pulls, mis-hits, which is just as well because this one doesn't carry to deep midwicket
length ball, middle and leg, drilled down the ground, all along the ground, and beats long-on. That' some shot
comes back with a short ball that beats the pull, hits him in the rib cage, but still goes for a leg-bye
length ball, angling in, driven to mid-off
short, outside off, looks to cut it, gets a bottom edge into the pitch
quicker one, full, and this has gone back at ten times the speed off the bat. Boy that has rocketed back all along the ground to long-off
slower this time, short too, punched to sweeper-cover for one
length ball, turning into the pads, worked between deep midwicket and deep square, and comes back for two
that's the one that doesn't turn, and goes off the leading edge through cover for one
Perera is providing a nice finishing touch to this innings. Length ball, no flight, on the pads, and he clears the front leg to loft this over long-on
swinging into the pads, Dilshan misses out, and is hit on the pad
full, middle and leg, gets an inside edge onto the pad. Over to Perera
short, Perera looks to pull, is late into the shot, and gets a single to long-on
full toss on the pads, Dilshan misses out, and gets just a leg-bye

boy that's exciting. Batsman with no fear, bowler looking to put him in his place with a bouncer. Perera is surprised, his head falls away, he is not looking at it, but the bat comes up with perfect timing, as he has timed this for six over square leg
slower ball, Perera slashes at it, and misses by a long way
another run-out missed. Slower ball, pulled straight to square leg, Dilshan gives up half way through, but Azhar Ali misses again
slower again, pulled to long-on for one
yorker from wide of the crease, dug out for a single
wide yorker... well bowled. He knows Perera is backing away, and bowls this yorker away from his reach but inside that white line
slower ball on off, he pulls with head falling away, gets a single to deep midwicket
full toss on the pads, inside edge onto the pads, and he gets just a single - a good final over with just five off

inn2.comm: and this goes to the slip. Hafeez plays a forward defensive outside off, gets a soft edge, and that falls well short of slip
walks down the pitch, moves across too, and defends one to cover
short of a length, on off, no movement, defended to cover
this one holds its line outside off, and he push-drives it to point where Dilshan fields
Hafeez is down the track again, and flicks this to short midwicket
starts off with a maiden as this lands on a length outside off, and Hafeez pushes at it
nice outswinger first up, headed towards where the fifth stump would be - defended
straighter, moving towards off, another defensive shot
this is wider, and is left alone. Malinga has under-cut on it, and this one doesn't carry to Sanga, and in fact bounces up towards his face
left alone outside off again, a very cautious start
short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover
successive maidens as he plays a defensive shot off the back foot
half-volley on off, pushed to mid-on
beautiful delivery, holds its line outside off, and Hafeez is playing for the inswinger. Beaten
short of a length, pretty straight, pushed back to Kula
first runs of the innings through a beautiful drive. Length ball, wide, Hafeez walks into the drive, pushing it on the up, between mid-off and cover

. Hafeez walks down the wicket to hit this to mid-on, and runs three-quarters of the way with Ali not responding at all. Tharanga at mid-on, too, can't quite make his mind up which end to go at, and that lets Hafeez get back. He gives Azhar a nasty stare, though
half an appeal for lbw but this is swinging way too far down leg

Missed. Both the batsmen have had let-offs now. Short of a length, moving away, Azhar slashes at it with no feet, and neither of the slips gets a hand to it, although this was catchable. MJ at second slip is late to react, and also blindsights Mathews at first slip, whose hands go up a little late too
lovely shot. Closer to off, short of a length, and he punches it square, between point and cover-point
slower ball, on off, and leaves him a bit, beating the defensive bat
slips in a bouncer, perhaps down leg, perhaps not, but not called. Good to see bowlers getting a little space to breathe

slower ball again, just outside off, Azhar checks his shot, and because he is early into it, he rolls his wrists on it to keep it down. He has timed it well, too, as it travels fast between the bowler and mid-off
outswinger at full pace, starts outside off, and is left alone
length ball, just outside off, shaping in, defended back to him
short, slight width, and it stays low to make sure Hafeez doesn't get any value from his attempted cut
length ball, into the pads, he steps down the wicket, and chips it over wide mid-on
oh, what a punch. Slightly short of driving length, just outside off, and he stands tall and meets it on the up. And it absolutely flies off the bat. Between cover-point and cover
inswinger into the pads, and he nicely flicks it over square leg for four
swinging into the pads, worked away for a single to deep square leg
and Azhar Ali is tucking into them at the moment. A gentle outswinger outside off, he presses forward, covers the movement, and drives this through cover. All along the ground
closer to off, slightly shorter too, defended now
short of a length, outside off, left alone
length ball, outside off, solidly defended to cover
outswinger, on a length, just outside off, defended with an open face
gives him the charge, Mathews shortens the length, and he ends up pushing this to cover
swinging into the pads, played with soft hands, past midwicket, for a couple
shimmies down, which helps him get outside the line as the ball swings in and beats the inside edge
short of a length, outside off, punched square for a couple
slower ball, Hafeez is not fooled, and he plays a solid forward-defensive
wide length ball, mis-hits a drive, finds the man at cover
short of a length, punched to extra cover, we have five men on the off-side circle
length ball, outside off, defended to cover
short of a length, outside off, shaping away, left alone
shimmies down the track to thrash this with an open face to third man
outswinger, not too far outside off, pushed to extra cover
outswinger, Hafeez gets an inside edge on the drive, they want a single to mid-on, but both rush back to their respective crease after taking about four steps towards each other
half-volley on off, driven nicely back down the ground, and Mathews gets a hand to it to take the sting out of it, and they get just two runs
short of a length, punched to cover
accurate delivery, no room, defended back to him
full inswinger, Azhar gets a little too far across and fails to make full use of it. Gets a inside edge onto the pad

Appeal for a run-out. Punched back down the ground, Kulasekara gets a hand to it, and Azhar Ali is diving to make it back after having backed up. This is well done by Azhar, who put the dive in to get back. He could have easily blamed luck for this, but he did all he could do, and survives
driven down to mid-off, doesn't find the gap
short of a length, outside off, punched away nicely, but finds mid-off
wide half-volley, Azhar's front foot moves closer to the line of the ball, and he has played a beautiful drive on one knee. Between cover and extra cover, all along the turf
slightly shorter, and he defends this one
this ball stops at him. A length ball, he is not quite close to it, but pushes in front of his body, and gets a single wide of cover
steps down the wicket, slashes at a shortish delivery, the outswing gets a thick edge that flies over point
left alone outside off, allowed to swing away
short of a length, wide, and despite the presence of a deep point, he has punched this wide of the man. Some lovely shots from Azhar so far

stunning caught and bowled by Perera. Sri Lanka needed some magic, and Perera has produced it. Length ball, driven back at him, Perera's natural reaction to get away from the stumps after delivering, so he fights that motion, and dives full length onto the pitch to grab this one-handed
short of a length, on off, Younis defends off the front foot
accurate, short of a length, no room, movement away to, defended
slightly fuller, but wider, and he opens the face to guide it past slip for one
short of a length, on the stumps, guided to third man for one
short of a length again, nipping in a little, defended off the front foot
full outswinger, wide too, and he reaches close to the line with his front foot, and drives it wide of short cover. He is timing them beautifully
wide again, but he is not quite close to it this time, and pushes it with soft hands
angling into the pads, and worked away for an easy single
short of a length, not too wide, left alone
slower, swingier, and YK defends with an open face
length ball, outside off, defended towards cover-point
outswinger, half-volley, driven to short cover
length ball, just outside off, defended towards mid-off
short of a length, no room, wants to tip and run, but he has hit it straight to cover
too straight now, played wide of deep midwicket for two
accurate again, aimed at top of off, no movement but no room either. Pushed back to him
short of a length, on off, punched square on the off side for a single
flighted outside off, pushed to sweeper-cover for one
flighted on middle and off, defended with a closed face
pushes at one outside off, the ball doesn't turn and takes the inside edge for a single
tossed up on off, the ball turns, and takes a soft outside edge past slip
well bowled, flatter, but turns too. Pitches on off, short of driving length, and it turns past the defensive bat
fuller now, and driven to sweepeer-cover for one
short of a length, no room, wants a single but is sent back as he has pushed this straight to cover
walks down the track, gets close to the pitch of the ball, and whips this past midwicket for a couple
pulls the length back, no room, defended to off
short and wide, and he cuts in the air, over point, and reaches a stylish fifty. Misbah and others stand up and applaud Azhar. Can he double it?
fuller, straighter, driven down the ground, and Perera gets a hand to it in the follow-through
short and wide again, steered to third man for one
nicely thrown up around off, nicely pushed to sweeper-cover for one
driven to long-off for a single
length ball, on off, defended
stays on that length, no turn, defended again
this one turns, takes the outside half of the defensive bat, Younis wants a single but Azhar sends him back
on a length, on off, angling in, defended back to him

Dropped. Sanga's face is like he has seen a ghost. This is a peach of a delivery. Leaves him after pitching just outside off, just short of a length, takes a thin edge, and flies to Sanga who is surprised by the carry, and is hit on the top of the palm. YK had begun walking when it was dropped, and somebody tried to sneak a run-out, but missed the stumps
short and wide, cut away for a single
half-volley, and gloriously driven between cover and extra cover. That's rub salt in the wound from that drop
steered away to third man for one

the horse hasn't quite bolted. YK, like life, presents Sanga a second opportunity, and he grabs it with both hands. A loose drive outside off, another edge, and this time - as Bob Willis would say - Sanga makes no mistakes. That was well short of a driving length
short of a length, on off, pushed to cover
slower ball, short, outside off, rides the bounce, steers it to third man
Misbah square-drives the first ball he faces from Malinga, and gets a single to third man
short of a length, on the stumps, worked wide of midwicket for one
length ball, swinging away, pushed to sweeper-cover for one
good short ball. Not dug in, but rises steeply towards the chest. Kept down by Azhar
slower ball, on a length, outside off, defended to cover-point
these guys are punishing any width tonight. Short of a length, wide, and he punches it between point and cover-point
gets width again, looks to smash it through the off side again, but this doesn't come on, and they take a single off the mis-hit
Mahela saves four. Width again, punched again, and Mahela dives full-length at cover-point
no room now, worked into the on side for a single
looking to dab this behind square, but doesn't get any room
length ball, on off, defended off front foot
full, driven to extra cover
that's lucky. Sharp bouncer at 143ks, and Azhar is well late into the pull, but the edge flies over the keeper's head
that has to be very close. Slower ball, full, beats him, pitched on middle and leg, cuts in, and would have missed leg. Another good decision
length ball, middle and leg, worked past midwicket
short of a length, on off, punched away square for a single
full outswinger, on off, near yorker, kept out
short of a length, stump to stump, pushed to midwicket
length ball, swinging in, flicked away for a single
dances down the track and places this to deep square for a single
Misbah too walks down the track, and places this shortish delivery into the leg side
full, near yorker, dug out to cover
full again, almost a yorker again, no run again
starts with a legcutter, short of a length, just outside off, beats the bat
extraordinary shot. He just dabs this into the ground, and it bounces well over point to get him a couple
short of a length, just outside off, pushed to cover
wide length ball, crashed into Dilshan at point. That has got to sting
walks across, gets inside the line, and flicks this to leg for a single
shortish, widish, punched to DIlshan at point
tips and runs, between cover and point, and they charge through
lower arm, flatter delivery, defended in front of off
tossed up, middle and off, defended to cover
the lap sweep, in the air, but fine of fine leg, comes back for two
lap again, Sanga tries to intercept it, but he has got it wide of him. Fine leg is finer, though, and keeps them down to one
full, on off, driven to long-off for one

near run-out. Played into the leg side, wide of deep midwicket, and they take Kula's throw on to take the second. Azhar has to be quick, and he beats the throw by half a frame. A second initiated by Azhar, and he makes it with a half-dive
length ball, outside off, pushed to point
moves across, punches this into the covers for one
and Azhar shimmies down the track, and is beaten by the outswing
walks down again, pushes a shortish delivery to mid-on
length ball, on the pads, worked away for a single
Misbah refuses an easy single. Azhar is down the track, clips this slightly wide of short fine, but Misbah sends him back
full, driven to long-off for one
full again, on off, pushed for an easy single to long-off
slower through the air, but full enough to drive down to long-off for one
pushed through, no turn, played back to him
and again driven down to long-off for one
short of a length, on off, pushed to cover
punched away again, but straight to cover again
no room again, short of a length, played back to Mathews
moves across to get inside the line of this one, and works it to leg for one
length, middle and leg, pushed to mid-on, can't get a single
length ball, outside off, driven to sweeper-cover for one
short of a length, no turn, the ball takes the inside edge, and goes for one to square leg
full, on the pads, clipped into the leg side, two is the original call, but Thirimanne charges in well from deep midwicket
walks down the track, bunts it into the on side for one
Misbah charges too, is not quite to the pitch of the ball, and plays a push-drive to cover
shortish, into the pads, hit for a single to deep midwicket
full, on the pads, worked away for an easy single
short of a length, middle and off, pushed wide of midwicket for one
moves across, gets inside the line again, and again takes a single to deep midwicket
gets the width, dabs this lenght ball to third man to get into the 80s
short of a length, wide, driven down to long-off for one
wants to tip and run, but Misbah sends him back as he sees the man from cover swooping in
drives at a wide length ball, gets a thick outside edge, and a diving Perera at third man keeps them down to just one
full, pushed to cover
tries the reverse-sweep, and is beaten outside off
looks to push this into the off side, and is surprised by the slight extra bounce
tries to drive this down the ground but can't beat Herath to his left
carrom ball, tries another reverse sweep, makes connection, but with the glove, and the ball dies on the pitch
flat delivery, stump to stump, defended to finish another maiden

Perera is having a great day. Gets a wicket with the first ball of a spell for the second time. A bit of an offcutter, short of a length, outside off, beats the inside edge, hits his back pad in front of off. The line is not a question here. The only doubt has to be the height, but Paul Reifell has no such doubts. And he has been spot on today
Akmal walks down again, edges an away swinger, but it bounces short of Mahela at slip
short of a length, wide, punched away to deep point
short of a length, on off, pushed back to Perera
that's wide, and Azhar throws his bat at it, but can't beat sweeper-cover
walks down the wicket, no room available, defends a shortish delivery
length ball, on off, gets a thick edge to point
charges down the track, pushes this back to the bowler
nearly another miracle catch. Hit in the air over the non-striker, and Herath dives full length. He also has to watch the non-striker. Doesn't get a hand to it
defended back to him
tossed up, defended solidly, but they take the single into the leg side
comes down the track, is beaten in the flight, but takes the leg-bye
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover for one

walks down the track, drives a length ball wide of cover, and also wide of deep cover. They want the second, but Akmal runs into the bowler, which costs him a second, and they decide against the second
short of a length, into the body, flicked away between the two deep fielders on the on side. Comes back for the second
short of a length, slightly wide, looks to drive this in front of square, but gets the inside half of the bat
punched back at him, but not powerfully enough to beat him in his follow-through
gets a wide length ball, but he charges at it, and hits it off the inside half of the bat for a single
nice turn for him as it pitches on a length outside off, and hits the thick outside edge of a defensive bat
chips down the track to push this down to long-on for one
stays back to a length ball, pushes it to cover
full, just outside off, defended again
looks to cut this one, but it is not short enough
extra bounce for a length ball as he goes back again, manages to keep it down, though
walks down the track, pushes this shortish delivery into the leg side

another wicket for Perera, another wicket before the Powerplay, but Umar Akmal can't believe he has been given out. Short of a lenght, looks to run it fine to the right of the keeper, misses, and has been given out. Replays show there is clear flood light between bat and ball. Akmal is not impressed
he gets four runs first ball, over the slip
driven to mid-off
pulled, keeps it down, gets a single to deep square
pushed to mid-on, doesn't get a single
driven to long-off for a single
bunted into the on side a single, wide enough of Herath
carrom ball, short too, punched down to long-off for one
full, driven to long-on for one
tries the big slog-sweep, but this is tossed up wide, and beats him
flatter, into the pads, worked away for a single
slower ball, on off, defended to cover
bouncer, and Afridi ducks under it
slower ball again, short of a length, opens the face, Azhar calls him through for a quick single
yorker, really quick, dug out, and guided to third man for one
slower bouncer, outside off, guided to third man for one
yorker, swinging away, just outside off, beats the bat, gets another dot in
full toss, he has mis-hit trying to hit it to Kandy, which is why it doesn't carry to long-on
Azhar gives him the charge, and despite its being short of a length, he crashes it between cover and extra cover. Azhar's first boundary since the 20th over

he has broken the leg stump into two. How fast bowlers love that sight. Azhar is making room, and Kula bowls the yorker, right at the base of the leg stump. It squeezes under the bat, and ends the innings short of a century
full ball, driven to long-on to get off the mark
yorker again, dug out to cover for one
short of a length, on off, no room, pushed back to Kula
low full toss as he strives for a yorker, clipped away for a single
slower ball, on the pads, nudged away for a single
misses the line with this attempted yorker, and length too. So it is a half-volley well outside leg, and he gets enough bat on it to send it flying to fine leg for four

that's a lovely catch from Sanga. That should do it for the game, and should make up for that drop too. It's a slower ball, mind you. Short of a length, Afridi looks to run it down, gets an edge, and it goes not only wide, it is also dying on Sanga. He dives full length, and plucks this one-handed. That's his 300th catch too. Not a bad way to bring it up
full and wide, played with an open face to point for a single
short, chest-high, keeps it down, but another dot
length ball, pitches leg, heads towards off, defended to cover
thick edge as he pushes outside off, gets a single to third man
length ball, on the pads, worked away for a single
short of a length, middle and leg, defended to leg
full toss, on off, pushed to mid-on
short of a length, middle and leg, played back to him. Just the formalities being carried out now
slower ball, short of a length, on off, defended with an open face
slower ball again, near yorker, dug out to point
short, into the ribs, helped away around the corner
slower ball, a yorker to boot, and Tanvir is beaten. No shame about that for a No. 8 who is perhaps batting a position too high
short now, rearing into the chest, defended
slower ball, leg-side half-volley, clipped away for a single. Gentle length ball on the pads, and with the lower pace Tanvir feels safe in going after him, and lofts him to deep square
Boy, can he ever? The third time he has taken a wicket with the first ball of a new spell tonight
full, on off, driven to mid-on
defended on the off side with an open face
nearly a sixth. Short of a length, looking to work it to leg, gets a leading edge back towards Perera. Falls short
wide length ball, cuts away, beats the drive, nearly a sixth again
short of a length, outside off, punched away for a single to sweeper-cover
short of a length, into the pads, deflected for a single
short of a length, holds its line outside off, beats the outside edge
short of a length, not too wide, pushed to cover
another defensive push to cover-point
stays short of a length, Gul continues his audition for a defensive No. 3
nicely punched away wide of cover for a single
Sanga wants a decision here. Sarf sweeps, Sanga collects. Sanga is certain he has bottom-edged it. Umpire doesn't budge. Replays are inconclusive
defended to cover
slog-sweeps this over midwicket for four
drags this down, pulled away to deep square leg for one
carrom ball, Gul recovers well, places this wide of deep midwicket for a couple
comes down again to take this on the full and drive it to long-on for one
Boy that is some shot. Short, not a long hop, mind you, and Gul has pulled this over long-on for six. Where did he get that power into that shot from? And this is no Mickey Mouse boundary
short of a length, swat-pulled this time, and Perera at midwicket dives full length on a barren patch, and saves four runs
slower ball, full, gets a leg-bye as this slides down leg
slower ball again, worked away off the pads for a single
another well timed shot by Gul, wide of extra cover for a single
yorker, gets an inside edge onto the pad
No. He bowls a full toss, driven for a single to sweeper-cover
nearly a sixth. Short of a length, cutting away, Sarf throws his bat at it, gets a thick edge, wide enough of Sanga, fine enough of third man
straight length ball driven to long-on for one
that's his No. 6, a personal best for Perera. Gul is a sitting duck. Stays in the crease, and swings across the length. Misses, and is dead plumb. Couldn't have been plumber
length ball, on off, defended to cover
slower ball, on off, defended, and Perera ends his night superbly - six wickets and a crazy catch
unfair on the lower order. This is a lethal yorker in front of leg. Keep those toes safe boys
slower ball, taken from off, worked between fine leg and deep square, gets a couple
low full toss on the pads, worked away for one
bouncer, sways out of its line
another short delivery, no allowance for Ajmal, and the top edge goes for four to fine leg
another short ball, Ajmal backs away and swings again, edges it safely through to Sanga. Better out than injured
length ball into the pads, wants to flick it behind square, but is beaten
slower ball, huge appeal for lbw as he misses a flick, and he is given. Was down the wicket, but that looked straight. Going down as it was an offcutter, but given. That levels the series
